Merge pull request #212 from vicb/patch-1

Allow using jQuery noConflict mode

Improve json detection

Before this change `this.load("/path/to/data.json?start=0")` would not be detected as JSON because of the presence of a query string -  `this.load("/path/to/data.json")` would be detected as JSON.

Of course it is possible to override the format using `options.json` but this little change would be a nice to have.

Allow using jQuery noConflict mode

In [noConflict mode](http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.noConflict/) $ is not defined, you have to use `jQuery`instead

Fix AMD issues.

Get hostname in a cross-browser compatible way Internet Explorer looses A.hostname property when href is set dynamically with .setAttribute('href', '/whatever'). This is a problem with client side templating engines like knockout.js. E.g. this link created with templating would not work correctly in sammy.js, as it does not have hostname. The issues is fixed by checking hostname, and if it is missing, create a new link and query the hostname from that link.

Merge pull request #89 from kevingessner/sammy

---

When a page loads with no hash, Sammy.HashLocationProxy._last_location == , so this condition remains true and hashchange is spuriously triggered over and over. It should only be triggered at initial page load (then _last_location is undefined) and when the hash actually changes.
HashLocationProxy does not need to constantly trigger the 'hashchange' event when there is no hash.

Fix for alternate form methods in IE (thanks to rmurphey for the catch and research)

IE incorrecly reports the value of the form's method attribute with $.fn.attr() if the method is not GET or POST. getAttribute seems to work reliably across browser.

Also, if there is a hidden _method input (like Rails style), Sammy will use that to calculate the verb.

Update to the latest haml-js v0.2.1. This version adds better whitespace support. String interpolation, and a simpler caching API that's several magnitudes faster.

Fix hashchange events in IE8 when compatibility mode is turned on. Closes #13

Thanks to a very smart idea from Brian Mitchell (binary42) I was able to avoid using specific browser checks. Instead, the proxy assumes that the hashchange
needs to be faked with polling, and then once (if) a native hash change event occurs, it stops polling.

Fix tests for plugin errors
use() now sends errors through error()

The Sammy.Application no longer adds the app to the elements .data()

The main use case for data() was giving you an access point to pull out your app and edit/extend it after run(). Now that you can access through Sammy(selector), this is kind of useless.

Changed: Error handling has been refactored.

Added a new error() method on app which is the base error handler. app.notFound() just calls error() which allows all errors to be easily silenced. Also wrapped the interal callback invocation in runRoute() in a try/catch that sends internal errors into error(). This makes it much easier to debug errors in post() routes, where an error in a post callback would cause the form to actually submit. Also there is no longer a silence_404 option on SammyApplication, instead use raise_errors: true/false which if set to false will just send errors to app.log()

Add any() alias
route() now takes the psudeo verb 'any' which appends the route to every route verb
$.sammy = Sammy (instead of Sammy.application)

Sammy() is a function itself (instead of just an object).

Sammy() is the top level object that is not a constructor, but a looker-uper
Sammy.apps holds an object that maps a selector to a single application. This
allows you to lookup and easily fetch/extend an app object from anywhere.
It also prevents multiple apps for selectors, which becomes hairy when trying to
figure out which app is handling which event. However, if you want to have multiple
apps on single selectors, its still possible - just use the new Sammy.Application()
(constructor) syntax.

Almost everything in Sammy.Application returns the application instance.

This should allow for optional jQuery-esque app creation as a chain:

e.g.

   $.sammy()
    .use(Sammy.Cache)
    .get('#/', function() {})
    .post('#/new', function() {})
    .run()

Use explicit function aliases to the different route verbs. route() returns the app.

New partial system dont care about your rendering engine.

Partial now figures out the rendering 'engine' based on the final extension of the path your fetching. An 'engine' is just a method that takes a string and an object. See the Sammy.Template plugin as an example.

Also if you include Sammy.Cache it will cache your requested files unless you say cache_partials = false.

First official Sammy Plugin: Sammy.Cache.

Moved plugin tests to their own file.
Sammy.Cache represents a good example of my current thinking about Sammy plugin best practices.

Simple implementation of an extensible caching system.

I'm going to extract this out into a plugin as soon as I work out the new templating system.

Routes are saved and looked up in order of definition instead of shortest first.

This is small but rather major change. This allows you to have more control over which route is matched first if you have two similar routes.
Make parse query more uniform with the rest of the code base

Rebuilt the internal event system to use jQuery's built in namespacing.

This means a couple things:
Applications can now catch normal events fired within the element that the app is bound to. However, within Application#bind() callbacks `this` is a Sammy.EventContext, even if the events were fired by elements and not with app#trigger().

Also, app#trigger formerly took an optional third argument which was the context in which to evaluate the callback. Instead, you can pass {context: your_desired_context} as the data argument to trigger.

Fix for post routes without redirects.

last_location is not set automaticaly by a post route, instead last_location is set to path when redirecting. This still fixes the recent bug of redirecting multiple times in a series (the proof is in the test).

Also, quick fix for logging in Safari.

Log synchronously (individual loggers can wrap in setTimeout if they want to not block)
form submissions will now always have a param $form is a jQuery object of the original form that submitted to the route

Changes to the way logging works

Sammy.addLogger() takes a function with an unknown number of arguments and and should print or do something useful with the information. You could potentially add a function that logs stats to couchdb

Sammy.Application#bindToAllEvents replaces addLogger() it adds listeners to ALL events, not just the app events. Sammy.Application#debug == true works the same way though uses bindToAllEvents internally.

Removing jresig's Class implementation shortcut in favor of protypical inheritence and jQuery.extend()

Fix for IE6 bug involving question mark in hash.

If a question mark appears in a URL fragment, IE6 will exclude the
question mark and everything after it from `window.location.hash`.  For
example, given the location:

    http://example.com/#/docs?page=1&per_page=10

The value of `window.location.hash` will be:

    #/docs

By bypassing `window.location.hash` and parsing the URL within Sammy to
extract the fragment we can avoid cross-browser inconsistencies like
this one.
Fixed query strings spilling into path param values.
